Hello I have a kraken and am curious if i can run it or other motors/motor controllers run by CAN bus with an arduino r4 wifi. If so how would i do that and could i use phoenix (i donâ€™t really know how the programming works hecause i am not a programmer. I also have a radio so am i able to control it the arduino with that?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-13T02:03:25.086Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":318,"readers_count":317,"score":173.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506271,"topic_slug":"non-frc-can-question","display_username":"Tyler Shelton ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76176,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/non-frc-can-question/506271/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3738658,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-13T02:49:12.652Z","cooked":"

Itâ€™s complicated.

Each motor controller had its own protocol and CTRE donâ€™t really publish their protocol. So it will be pretty hard for talon FX without using their library. However, they do have some basic control which allow you to set the motor power.

CTR Electronics

Where can I find the CAN Protocol for CTR Devices?

CTR Electronics does not publish the full CAN specification for our products. This is due to incidents of IP theft from competing companies - as such the protocol is not available.   Phoenix 6 Devices Supported Platforms We provide Phoenix 6...

For REV, they have their protocol available on GitHub.

github.com

GitHub - REVrobotics/REV-Specs: Software specifications for REV products

Software specifications for REV products

I tried to talk to a REV Servo hub for PWM output via python script. End up with this robot controlled by a Nintendo switch.

image1920Ã—2560 357 KB

I would not imagine it is hard to port it to Arduino. (Or ESP32 as it is more commonly used in my end). But this was just a joke project with my friend.

That journey began here:

Custom CAN Sensor - ESP32 development board Control System
For the last couple weeks, I had a project that dig deep into creating custom CAN devices for FRC use. And now itâ€™s time to create something thatâ€™s more integrated. I donâ€™t really have a name for it, but this is a ESP32 based development board specifically tailored for FRC use. 5-30V input voltage range by TPS5450 WAGO connector ESP32-WROOM-32D MCU RGB LED for diagnostic 2 user button (with one being BOOT) TJA1050 CAN transceiver and switchable termination resistor Relay for doing something â€¦

Isaac-The-Pro:

did you install linux on it specifically for this project

Yes.

Custom CAN Sensor - ESP32 development board Control System
Showing off my test rig today. [image] [image] Also keep noting that one of the rig is running by a switch lite with Ubuntu.

I have 2 demo / test setup. One is custom dev board solution, the other is generic COTS solution. As it as well understand that not all teams would have the resource to print their own dev board, all the code in my project are cross compatible with COTS ESP32 dev board and my own custom made board.

Switch is for running the demo of COTS solution jig. Custom board jig have a full beelink mini pc so I could run arduino IDE, full socket can driver and wpilib while switch just run a python-can script with slcan (serial) CAN adapter for some simple demo. also custom side have roboRIO.

These two racks can be connected together (CAN and ethernet) or work independently. ethernet is for VNC and sftp into switch to do software update.

Itâ€™ll be a lot simpler to control the motors over PWM, which they can natively accept, than CAN, especially with an Arduino.

CTR Electronics

PWM Control

CTR Electronics motor controllers support "hobby" style 1-2ms rise-to-fall PWM control.

Krakens do support PWM for basic duty cycle control, as is documented in the link sent previously in this thread. For anything more advanced than that, our Phoenix 6 API is supported on several non-FRC systems, including a Raspberry Pi with a generic SocketCAN adapter.
